stepTitle: For a reaction to be spontaneous at a general temperature T, the change in free energy (ΔG) must be negative. Considering the relation ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - TΔS, where ΔH is the change in enthalpy and ΔS is the change in entropy, under what condition will a reaction be spontaneous if the change in entropy is negative?
choices: ΔH $$ \geq $$ $$0$$ and T is very high
